headline: Carney Gets Down to Work as Canada Election Drumbeat Grows
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Mark Carney laid the groundwork to take over as Canada’s prime minister as soon as this week, appointing a chief of staff and promising a speedy transition to a new cabinet that he says will be focused on the economy and fighting back against US tariffs. headline: Goldman Sachs managing director Scott Rubner leaves firm, source says
summary: Scott Rubner, a managing director in the derivatives sales and macro execution team at Goldman Sachs, has left the investment bank, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday. ...

summary: NEW YORK -Hedge funds reduced their exposure to stocks on Friday at the largest amount in more than two years, according to a Goldman Sachs note released on Monday. The bank added some...

headline: Goldman’s Top European IPO Banker Set to Retire After 31 Years
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Christoph Stanger, one of the longtime leaders in Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s equity underwriting business across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, is retiring after more than 31 years. headline: JPMorgan joins Goldman, hikes euro area's 2025 economic growth forecast
summary: Similar to Goldman, JPM expects growth to increase by 0.1 percentage point to 0.8%.  For 2026, JPM expects 1.2% growth, up by 0.3 percentage points.  "This revision is primarily driven by Germany, but we also anticipate slightly stronger growth across the rest of the region from spillovers and slightly looser fiscal policy," said JPM economists in a note dated late Friday.

headline: Goldman Sachs Group (NYSE:GS) Shares Dip 6% As Apple Card Partnership Sale Explored
summary: Goldman Sachs Group (NYSE:GS) recently appointed Elizabeth Overbay as CFO in its asset and wealth management division, signifying its focus on diversification. This follows board appointments of KC McClure and John Waldron, emphasizing governance and operational strengthening. Despite these appointments, the company's share price dipped 5.8% last quarter. Factors include the company's exploration of selling its Apple card partnership and a class-action settlement approval, possibly...
